newsitem.title: UK: LIFFE cocoa drifts down before holiday, volume low.
newsitem.headline: LIFFE cocoa drifts down before holiday, volume low.

text.p: LIFFE cocoa futures drifted lower amid extremely thin, pre-holiday trade on Friday.
July slipped seven stg to 1,022 stg per tonne and September dropped nine to 1,039 at midday. But volume was extremely low at a total 422 contracts and no options.
Traders attributed losses to light speculative liquidation after New York closed sharply lower on Thursday. They said thin conditions before a three-day weekend exaggerated the moves.
U.S. and London markets are both closed on Monday for holidays.

Technically, some analysts still expected July to edge up in the next couple of weeks to test resistance near 1,060 again. July has tested that level twice and failed, but analysts said the third time could succeed. They said oscillators were looking bullish despite the recent sideways market.
July support rests at 1,000 and then, at the April 9 low of 980.
